summary: Jesters, or fools, were entertainers in royal courts and at public events. They wore colorful, funny clothes and told jokes, sang, and performed tricks to make people laugh. Jesters could be found in the homes of rich people or traveling at fairs. They were good at singing, storytelling, and even magic. Often, their jokes were about famous people or events that the audience knew well. Even today, people dress up as jesters to bring joy at special events.
title: Jester
